headline: Harris under fire for drawing parallels between ICE and KKK
subHeadline: Potential 2020 hopeful Sen. Kamala Harris is facing backlash after comparing U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement to the Ku Klux Klan during a hearing on Capitol Hill; reaction and analysis on 'The Five.'

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, CO-HOST
utterances.sentences: Hello, everyone. I'm Dana Perino along with Tammy Bruce, Marie Harf, Jesse Watters, and Greg Gutfeld. It's 5 o'clock in New York City, and this is "The Five." The immigration battle front and center as the first wave of the caravan is met with violence in Tijuana, Mexico. Local residents clashing with the migrants and chanting this.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And potential 2020 hopeful, Kamala Harris, facing backlash after this exchange during a confirmation hearing for the nominee to head ICE.

utterances.speaker: SEN. KAMALA HARRIS, D-CALIF.
utterances.sentences: Are you aware of the perception of many about how the power and the discretion at ICE is being used to enforce the laws? And do you see any parallels?

utterances.speaker: RONALD VITIELLO, ACTING DIRECTOR OF IMMIGRATION AND CUSTOMS ENFORCEMENT
utterances.sentences: I do not see any parallels between --

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: I'm talking about perception.

utterances.speaker: VITIELLO
utterances.sentences: -- officers and agents.

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: I'm talking about perception.

utterances.speaker: VITIELLO
utterances.sentences: I do not see a parallel between what is constitutionally mandated as it relates to enforcing the law --

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: Are you aware that there's a perception --

utterances.speaker: VITIELLO
utterances.sentences: I see no --

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: Are you aware that there's a perception?

utterances.speaker: VITIELLO
utterances.sentences: -- that puts ICE in the same category as the KKK. Is that what you're asking me?

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: No, I'm very specific about what I'm asking you. Are you aware that there's a perception that ICE is administering its power in a way that is causing fear and intimidation, particularly among immigrants?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right. He kept his cool there, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, CO-HOST
utterances.sentences: Yeah. It was really -- I respect her, but I thought that was a very sleazy, sleazy move. It's a way of asking a question without asking a question. Some would say, Jesse, that you drink heavily, not me, but some would say. That's what she did. She said there's a perception of what would you say to the perception, and the thing is the only reason why the perception would exist is because she is laying the perception out there. You know, some may say that ICE is like the KKK. You are the some. But you're too cowardly to admit that you're the some. So, I thought that stunk to high heaven. And he answered it correctly.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Again, he's trying to get confirmed to be the head --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: By the way, I don't think that you drink heavily.

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, CO-HOST
utterances.sentences: Yeah. If there's a perception --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Very heavily. No, no, no, he doesn't.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: The show is getting off to a great start.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: No, we're OK.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Happy Friday.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Some would say your hair is beautiful, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Some would say it's your turn to talk.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK. First of all, Kamala, what she did, I agree, you can't frame the question as guilt by association. I can say there's a perception that Democrats are pro-crime, and there's a perception that the Democrats --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And there's a perception that the Democrats are open borders. And that's actually -- there's more of a perception than that than there's a perception that ICE is akin to the KKK. Now, she needs to go -- her history books. The KKK terrorized the south for decades and hung innocent African-Americans. They were supported by the Democratic Party, OK? She, African-American senator, should know that and that comparison is so outlandish and so disrespectful to the ICE agents that are just doing their job. Do you know who's really scared of ICE and who should be scared? Human traffickers, drug traffickers, criminal illegals that have skipped bail and are now still in the United States. Those people should fear ICE and there's a good reason for that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Marie you're up.

utterances.speaker: MARIE HARF, GUEST CO-HOST
utterances.sentences: I will say though that there is a perception. We have seen not based on what Senator Harris said but based on real people who have come in to contact with ICE who are either trying to claim asylum, who've had their --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You compare them to the KKK?

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: I'm not making that comparison. Where she took the question was, are you aware there's a perception that people are scared. When these people have had their children taken from them, some of them don't know where they are. Some of the adults have been deported back without their children. I think it's a completely fair question to ask him.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: She asked it incorrectly.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right. She inserted the KKK when she didn't need to do that.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: That's fine. And I think she's well aware of the history of the KKK, I should say, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, she should be more responsible with her analogy.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: Let me say, you're focusing on that piece of it. The question that we heard her say when she expanded on it, when she went back and drilled back down was a completely fair question. There are a lot of people today who are scared of ICE, who are fearful because some of the stories are quite, frankly, horrible.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: And she should be able to answer that question.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And if she said that in a court of law, don't you think there -- objection.

utterances.speaker: TAMMY BRUCE, GUEST CO-HOST
utterances.sentences: Oh, yes --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Sustain.

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.sentences: And people might have that perception because of her rhetoric.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: No, because of their actions.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Do they act like the KKK?

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.sentences: But let's remember that on the border it's not ICE that is separating families. It's the custom and border protection, right? ICE goes after people who are -- goes after MS-13 in the interior of the country. Illegal aliens who are engaging in money laundering, in drug trafficking. That's interior work. They're, in fact, saving the immigrant communities from these beasts that target them like MS-13, so they're the actual -- they're the ones who are, you know, helping the average American in general, certainly immigrant Americans. So her saying -- she doesn't even really know what ICE is doing --

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: Yes, she does.

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.sentences: But let's make it clear this is posturing for 2020.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: She knows exactly what she's doing.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I have a perception she's running for president.

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.sentences: But let me add that this also was exactly -- it felt like the Kavanaugh hearing. And it's the same attitude, the same insulting approach, the same innuendo Americans didn't like in the Kavanaugh hearing. They're not going to like if this is what they're going to continue to do for two years. It will backfire.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: Everything can't be criticized and then say this is like Kavanaugh.

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.sentences: It is.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: There are --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's just like Kavanaugh.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: There are criticisms of ICE that cross party boundaries. It's OK. He's up for the position. He should get asked tough questions. And ICE --

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.sentences: But real ones.

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.sentences: They save people's lives. And they save the lives of immigrants and young women.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: And they do these huge roundups of immigrants across the country --

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.sentences: Criminal immigrants who are -- where there are warrants and that they're looking for.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: That is not true. They have expanded their power beyond what they used to have. And there are whole immigrants -- and you know what? If what you're saying Tammy is true. If that's true, he could have taken that opportunity to say I understand there are these false fears out there. Here's why --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Playing the victim, Marie. Just like Kavanaugh.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: She's comparing the KKK. She's like what the hell is going on here?

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: He could have actually batted down some of these theories if he doesn't think they're true.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I would flipped that.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: Not just say, I don't know what you're talking about. He could --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He did a pretty good job. I would have flipped out, Marie. So would you.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No, he held his exposure.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: I don't think he did.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Marie, he held his composure like you used to at the podium, state department -- we're going to switch gears --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, nice transition.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: People say I'm good at that. All right. There's an ongoing fight, as you know, between the White House, CNN's Jim Acosta. And earlier today, a judge ruled that the Trump administration must reinstate his press pass. Chris Wallace is sitting down with President Trump this weekend for Fox News Sunday. He asked him about these latest developments. Watch this.

utterances.speaker: PRESIDENT DONALD TRUMP
utterances.sentences: What they've said though is that we have to create rules and regulations for conduct, et cetera, et cetera. We're doing that. We're going to write them up right now. It's not a big deal. And if he misbehaves we'll throw him out or we'll stop the news conference.

utterances.speaker: CHRIS WALLACE, FOX NEWS
utterances.sentences: What are your rules going to be? What is it that you're saying that this is over the line and you --

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Yes, they're doing them now. We'll have rules of decorum. You know, you can't keep asking questions. We had a lot of reporters in that room. Many, many reporters in that room and they were unable to ask questions because this guy gets up and starts, you know, doing what he's supposed to be doing for him and for CNN, and, you know, just shouting out questions and making statements, too. But I will say this, look, nobody believes in the first amendment more than I do. And if I think somebody is acting out of sorts, I will leave, I'll say thank you very much, everybody, I appreciate your coming, and I'll leave.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right, Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: This is so perfect because what this is about is a violation of the fifth amendment which is a right to due process like Kavanaugh. Here's the point --

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: I will regret saying that forever.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So the media is now up in arms over the violation of due process because a guy lost his hard pass even though his daily pass. But they were seemingly very silent when a guy lost his due process when he was accused of sexual assault from 35 years ago. By the way, I'm for due process for everything, OK? So I think it's -- I'm glad that they're finally saying, hey, due process, good thing.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, we love due process. The judge did not rule, Jesse, on the first amendment issue. It was this fifth amendment issue. Sounds to me, though, like the White House is saying, OK, like we've made our point, and Acosta is going to be Acosta but he might not be well-thought of by his colleagues.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's definitely time to move on considering the judge that made the ruling was a Trump appointed judge.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: He just ruled it on the law.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Exactly. There's not an argument to say, oh, this is an Obama appointed judge, of course. I think everybody is willing now to take a step back. I'm just glad that Donald Trump is restoring decorum and civility to the White House. It's about time because the Democrats and the reporters have been really running wild and have been disrespecting the traditions that we so hold dear in this sort of public. And it's just -- you know, I'm glad that this is being restored.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I don't know why I'm laughing, I could not agree more.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: What's so funny? Acosta was not respecting the dignity of the White House.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: Is Donald Trump going to have to start respecting the dignity of the White House? Is he going to have to start acting with decorum when he's --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Is there a perception that he's not?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: What was he's not doing --

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: When he cuts people off. When he calls them stupid and rude. Is he going to have to start playing by some rules, too?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I don't think he's broken any rules. I think he was fine and he said if anybody acts up we're going to boot him.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Look it up.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: Was it Thomas Jefferson. Jesse is on a history tear tonight.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They told me Jefferson pulled a lot of hard passes.

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.sentences: Dana, you mentioned that his colleagues, Acosta's colleagues, don't like what he does, and now they're going to be the ones who are -- in a way, going to have to be in charge to get the little child to sit down, otherwise the entire thing will end. And I think that's the power of the presidency. It's a perfect way to handle it and they'll be --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I think they're going to put him in the deep freeze. That's my recommendation.

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Don't put anybody in the deep freeze, Marie?

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: Had to kick somebody off the plane once.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's not the deep freeze, though.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: No

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Who was it?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You pushed him off the plane?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Was it David Gregory?

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It was David Gregory, wasn't it? He had some fun pills.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: It was not.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No, no, no. OK, Nancy Pelosi's bid to become house speaker facing some resistance. And now supporters are saying sexism is to blame, the details next.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: The battle over who will be the next house speaker is heating up. Nancy Pelosi meeting, face to face, this morning with potential rival Marcia Fudge in what Pelosi's team is calling a, quote, candid and respectful conversation. Fudge talking to reporters after the sit-down about whether or not she'll challenge Pelosi.

utterances.speaker: REP. MARCIA FUDGE, D-OHIO
utterances.sentences: There's a lot to think about. It's not a decision to just say, oh, I'm going to wake up today and be the speaker. It's not how this works. And I'm a very serious person. (INAUDIBLE) and I'll decide.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED REPORTER
utterances.sentences: How soon we expect to hear from you on your decision?

utterances.speaker: FUDGE
utterances.sentences: After Thanksgiving.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED REPORTER
utterances.sentences: That could be months after --

utterances.speaker: FUDGE
utterances.sentences: No, no, no, it wouldn't be. I mean, literally, after Thanksgiving.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: With opposition mounting, Pelosi's allies are fighting back with new claims of sexism. Democratic Senator Kirsten Gillibrand says it's a factor in the, quote, Never Nancy Movement.

utterances.speaker: SEN. KIRSTEN GILLIBRAND, D-N.Y.
utterances.sentences: Well, there is a lot of sexism in politics, a lot of sexual bias. It's pretty much every industry that you want to look at. You probably know it in your own industry. And so, I'm sure that's a factor. But, I think she's qualified, and she is extraordinary, and she is strong, and she will make a very effective speaker.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: So, Dana, I've always said that I think some of the criticism of Pelosi has some sexism in it, but I don't think that challenging her for speaker necessarily speaks to that. But, I want you to respond to the counter argument that people are making this week. Chuck Schumer reelected on a voice vote to be head of Democrats in the senate even though Democrats lost seats there, didn't pick up seats whereas Nancy Pelosi helped --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Here's the thing about Chuck Schumer, so he's only been the minority leader for one congress, two years. Harry Reid before that for a long time, right? So Nancy Pelosi has been in power for a long time. And people have been calling for is change. They asked for it in 2016. They asked for more of it in 2018. And so, I don't think it's so much sexism as it is we are looking for a new generation. We want to see some changes around here. I actually think that Marcia Fudge, very interesting. I don't think she went in to the meeting with Nancy Pelosi thinking, hmmm, maybe I could get something out of this. But if you are a Democrat thinking you want to get something out of this, you need a new bridge in your district, you need something else, you want a committee chairmanship, I'd go in and say to Nancy Pelosi I'm thinking of challenging you, too.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: Right. It's not a bad --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Horse trading.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: So --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Brilliant.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: -- Jesse --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: -- as of right now, Nancy Pelosi doesn't seem to have the votes there. A lot of new members who've said they won't support her. But you can't beat something with nothing. And I know you probably want her to be speaker, right, as a foil?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, I do.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well -- yeah, I don't think the Democrats want to stick their necks out right now because Nancy will just chop it off. But, I think someone eventually is going to have to grow up and put their name out there and throw their name in the hat. Yeah. So -- what I do think, though, is the Democrats should just focus on substance and qualifications and not throw an ism out there. Every argument they have is sexism, racism, nativism, we're just sick of it. We'd rather just talk about the facts. And what this does, I think, is foreshadows what you're going to see in the Democratic primary when people run for president. You're going to have a woman who thought she was a Native American running against another black woman. Running against a straight white male. Maybe there's a gay Democrat in there. There's going to be so much, as Greg likes to say, identity politics on that stage. It's going to be interesting to see if Democrats really go after each other on those issues. Are they able to pull back and really debate on substance? I don't think they're going to be able to. It's too tempting for Democrats to throw these ism cards down because that's all they know.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Good thing to come up with like for a Christmas gift, ism cards.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: Ism cards.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Ism cards, yeah.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: Greg is going to bingo ism cards. So, Greg, Nancy Pelosi has her flaws, certainly. And I do think a lot of Republicans -- she's very -- has a high negative marks by a lot of Republicans.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I deeply respect her.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: She also helped win almost 40 seats back. So I was skeptical of her, and I still am, but do you see someone else in the Democratic Party who could lead as effectively as she does right now?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't know because I don't pay attention that much to the Democratic Party. I'll be honest with you, I don't know many of them. This is the culmination of identity politics. You just start devouring your own.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Sooner or later there's nobody left but the person in your room and then you'll start pointing fingers at them. You know, it's cannibals eat their own family, ultimately. But, here's my -- I pose this question.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Who says women can't be sexist against women, right? Because they are --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But they are saying that. They're saying that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They're saying that.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: If you believe men could be sexist but women can't be sexist, then you're saying women can't do the same things as men which means you are sexist just like Kavanaugh. So, if you deny a woman's ability to be sexist to another woman, then you, in effect, are being sexist. Women -- by the way --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You lost me, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, no, no, Jesse --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: This is true.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: -- women can be as every bit of sexist to women.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Because they're saying if you did not -- if you're a woman --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Especially libs versus conservatives.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: What they're saying if you're a woman that did not support Hillary Clinton, did not vote for her, and you're a woman that doesn't supports Pelosi, and there could be several Democrats that are both, that that they as women are being sexist towards Pelosi.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: Which is why Marcia Fudge is an interesting possible candidate. Tammy, what do you think?

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.sentences: Well, look, I think that the left has always been looking at everybody who's their opposition as the others. So, it's not just that you're a sexist, is that you're not really a woman if you're not really towing the line --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.sentences: -- right? So that becomes the problem. You're actually dismissed as a human being. I think Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez should be the new speaker.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I agree.

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.sentences: See, this is the problem. They want something new. The new crowd really doesn't know much. They're completely immersed in the issues. But Nancy Pelosi is the only one who raises money. She's the only one --

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: She's not anymore. Not anymore.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I think, Alexandria, basically, those progressives are making the centrist of the Democratic Party stronger.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Look like adults.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: I totally agree. Also, house speaker doesn't have to be a member of the house.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's why Greg's running.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, and I'm looking for a strong write in vote.

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.sentences: Whoever is responsible for the wins, we're always told it's Donald Trump, maybe Donald Trump should be speaker of the house.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: My money is on Beto. I'm going with Beto.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Beto?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He's the master.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: Joy Behar changing tunes here, thrashing the country music awards, see why, next, when The Fives return.

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.sentences: Joy Behar melting down over the country music awards. She took issue with the fact that they avoided politics, darn it, and did not trash President Trump.

utterances.speaker: JOY BEHAR, 'THE VIEW' CO-HOST
utterances.sentences: Maybe I'm overreacting to this, but I believe that everybody should be involved in politics right now. I really do. I don't believe that you get a pass just because you're a performer. Not everybody wants to watch it on television. I get that.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: OK, that's what she's talking about.

utterances.speaker: BEHAR
utterances.sentences: My personal belief is that we are in an emergency. The democracy is at risk.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I do think that sometimes it's like when I do my shows. I don't want to talk about politics.

utterances.speaker: BEHAR
utterances.sentences: It's fine. I want to talk about me.

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.sentences: All right --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's a great song by Toby Keith called I want to talk about me.

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.sentences: Yeah --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: There is.

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.sentences: Look, there's a lot to discuss here. But one thing we know, she even admits that maybe she's overreacting. Greg, would you agree with that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: She's the only person on this earth who wants more politics in everyday life. Wherever politics is injected, whether it's sports, movies, or music, it introduces friction and anger. It makes everything worse. But she isn't saying she wants more politics in life. She wants her politics, her politics. If the country music singer came out against something that she was for, she wouldn't be saying this. The scary thing about this is, it's shifting from -- it used to be if the left disagreed with you, they thought you were evil, remember? We think they're wrong. They think you're evil. Now, nonparticipation is evil. Now, if you don't speak up and participate, you're a collaborator. You're just like a Nazi.

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.sentences: And in her way that if you don't speak up -- like, maybe they would speak up but pro-Trump, I mean, God forbid, right? Then she'd be complaining. At the same time, we know that when things have gotten political like when the Obamas or Michelle Obama would appear on the Oscars and all of that going on with that, the ratings go down. Americans, over all, reject it because we want an escape, right? We do want a break. And that's the job of performers, is to give us something to entertain ourselves not to give us some angst. Or, of course, there's a responsibility because they do influence culture. Do you think that there should be a balance?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I think that -- look, I think that -- the country music as an industry knows its audience, right? Like, for example, why do I play country music on The Five, Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

utterances.sentences: Because I know my audience. Also, Joy says that democracy is at risk. The Democrats just picked up almost 40 seats in the house. They did very well in the upper Midwest. They took governorship that we didn't expect. There's one Republican left in New England. So, democracy is not at risk. Democracy is actually working. I didn't get to watch the CMA's. I usually watch every year. I was on a flight. I do know one thing that Dirks Bentley got robbed.

utterances.speaker: BRUCE

No one wants to see any music shows where people are talking about Trump even though country music is pretty MAGA. No one wants to see it. I agree with Greg and I agree with Dana, democracy is working. People are fine. Joy is the only one that's lighting her hair on fire and she is just doing that for attention. When she brought the subject up, she said I may be crazy here but.

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.sentences: She is overreacting.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS

So L'Oreal honors extraordinary women every year, these are selfless volunteers that serve their time - give their time to their communities. It's a signature philanthropic program that celebrates women across the country and finds true beauty in giving back. That's SreyRam Kuy at the 2017 Women of Worth gala, that was last year and she was recognized for all her work with military veterans and their families as well as providing pro bono surgery to low income patients. They have ten women that they give awards to and if you go to womenofworth.com, there is an extra $35,000 for the charitable cause, depending on how vote for, so if you go there check it out, Jesse, I know you are on top of that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I'm all over that. Ever been to Disney World?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Ever been to Splash Mountain, anybody?

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK, well, losers. If you guys go down Splash Mountain, you know how you do the thing where you can get the picture of yourself screaming and freaking out?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well a military veteran, a guy name Dion Cini put a picture of Trump 2020. Held up the sign on Splash Mountain while he was going down just for the photograph. Having a little fun but, guess what? He is now permanently banned from Disney.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: That's ridiculous.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Disney released a statement, "Walt Disney World welcomes all guests to enjoy our parks however demonstrations and the display of signs and banners is not permitted on the premises." I think Disney is way out of line here. Do they own us now?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK good.

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.sentences: Quite the opposite.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I don't know how I feel about the story now. Next person.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You didn't plug your show. "Watters' World" 8:00.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: We have ladies diamond and silk and Ann Coulter and Brian Kilmeade. It's the all stars.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He really brings it. He really brings it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: The Greg Gutfeld Show, Saturday 10 p.m. I got Walter Kern. I got Joe Divito, (inaudible). 10 p.m. tomorrow night, it's going to be great. Now it's time for "Greg's Heoric News." All right check this out. We've got a tenacious bunny digging, digging. What could it be digging? Well maybe there happens to be a little friend that's trapped on the other side, a little paw perhaps you can see come up. Look at that, look at that. But the bunny nose, he can't quit so he keeps trying and trying. Get back over there. There he's trying, he's trying. Keep digging, keeps digging, keeps digging. Come on, you almost got it. Don't leave. Don't leave. Go back there you stupid bunny.

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.sentences: There it is.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's amazing. Oh my God.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I planned that whole thing. I actually put the cat in there I filmed it.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: I always do sports news. Near Charlottesville, special needs students at Albemarle County High School in Virginia played their annual basketball game on Wednesday, the fourth year it's been played because so many of them wanted to play team sports but didn't feel like they could make the basketball team. So the university of Virginia players were their coaches. And you can watch the footage online these kids just had the night of their lives. It was great.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Very cool.

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.sentences: Camel on the snow storm, people driving on a Pennsylvania highway yesterday saw a camel on the side of the road. Look at this.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.sentences: Fact of the matter is don't worry. The camel, his name is Einstein, was going to an event for the Jewish Federation of greater Philadelphia. Got stuck in the snow with his humans and he ended up returning safe and sound to the petting zoo.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Guess that makes this hump day.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right. That's it for us. I'm sure you've had enough. SPECIAL REPORT is up next. Hey -- Bret.

utterances.speaker: BRET BAIER, FOX NEWS
utterances.sentences: Never enough -- Dana. Thank you. Content and Programming Copyright 2018 Fox News Network, LLC. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED. Copyright 2018 CQ-Roll Call, Inc.
